result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:47 AM Defendant Kayla Marie Decora appeared by video, in custody from Barron County.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Kayla Marie Decora.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reviews the speedy trial demand, and Motion for Attny Gill to withdrawal from case.   Attny Gill makes statement.   Discussion takes place for new trial dates.    Court orders - Special Verdict Forms, Jury Instructions, Witness List to be filed by Friday October 28, 2022.   Jury Trial set.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:56 AM Defendant Kayla Marie Decora appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Kayla Marie Decora.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court reviews the motion filed by Attny Gill to withdraw as Counsel for DEF, Court indicates Judge Yackel previously denied withdrawal request.  Attny Gill indicates no time on schedule to handle trial until January.   State request to set speedy trial.   12:03PM  OFF THE RECORD FOR SCHEDULING.    State indicates 2-days.  
12:08 PM  BACK ON THE RECORD:  JA assists with scheduling speedy trial, and final pre-trial.  Attny Gill to submit calendar with conflicts for dates of jury trial.

DATE DECLINED: September 12, 2022
Attorney took a public defender appointment knowing that a request for a speedy trial
demand was possible. A speedy trial demand was made. Attorney must make
arrangements for the trial. Withdrawal is denied.

11:31 AM Defendant Kayla Marie Decora appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Gill indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State calls witness, Detective Poplin, sworn in by court.  State request Court to take Judicial notice of  Sawyer County Case 20CF199, Attny Gill no objection, Court takes judicial notice.  State begins examination.  11:34 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  11:41 AM  State tenders witness.  11:41 AM Cross-Examination by Attorney Gill.  Attny Gill no further questions.  11:43 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Gill no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.
